channel.title: University applications
channel.description: Well there will be quite a few of you this year applying for uni's and applications have to go off soon so where you applying? im going for Westminster, Brighton, Staffordshire, Derby and Demontfort all for varying Games programming/Development degrees

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:18, topic:309187”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=405635.msg3000530#msg3000530 date=1255946476]
Looking at Leciester, Coventry, Plymouth and Eastbourne. Doing a Computing degree with a year in industry hopefully. First choice is defo Leciester, but not sure about insurance.

What have you all been predicted for A-Level? Mines BBB
[/quote]
There’s a uni in eastbourne? News to me. I live right next to it and I’ve never heard of an Eastbourne Uni.

I’m predicted ADD so I doubt I’ll get in anywhere.[/quote]

haha. dam. Bournemouth…

face palm

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Why is it that so many apply for computing degrees? Isn’t it possible to take other things such as psychology?

Nobody in my college is applying for computer science, but one person is taking ict. I think it may have something to do with the fact we’re all posting on nerd forums so you’d expect the number of people applying for computer science to be higher yes?

Read full topic

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

inertia:

Mr.Chris, I looked at leicester too and it seemed fairly good for computer science but I’ve heard bad reviews about the university so I’m wondering if they’re just trying to make it look more appealing.

well, it was university of the year last year. Not sure how much that means, but their computing department is pretty well praised from loads of institutions around the world.

Read full topic

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

sanga282:

im specifically applying for games development normal computer science was an option but would prefer games development, we get out own lab suites and there are about 10 xbox’s and PS3’s in the test lab for games dev students only so there are certain perks as well

If you want xbox’s apply for staffs, I saw a few while walking to the cs room

Read full topic

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

So you’ve chosen your degree while actually weighing in a bonus such as gaming consoles as a factor? Pathetic.

I wish my university had gaming consoles. It used to but doesn’t now… Not that I wouldn’t be ashamed playing video games at uni when there are two perfectly good bars on campus.

Read full topic

item.title: University applications

item.title: University applications
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

I live about 10 minutes away from Staffordshire uni, and the open day was quite impressive a few weeks ago. They’re really well organized and the computing facilities there are phenomenal. The lecturers are truly inspirational and make you want to excel in everything you do.

No actually I was just joking, it’s shit. What are your predicted grades? Are you specifically applying for a games development degree or are you interested in other related programmes such as computer science?

Mr.Chris, I looked at leicester too and it seemed fairly good for computer science but I’ve heard bad reviews about the university so I’m wondering if they’re just trying to make it look more appealing.

Greeny:

Someone come to Manchester :))

I wanted to go there but they wont accept physics instead of maths

Read full topic

item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I’m probably not going to uni any time soon unless I take my job offer in the air force who will pay for it, but I’d have to move down to the middle of fuck knows in NSW if I take it.

Might go to uni a few years down the track if I decide to do an apprenticeship in industrial control - the experience would help me smash though an electrical engineering degree.
